scenes.label: *start
texts: Nonno stopped working and started the final checks.
Beary-Airy b.2 is com-com-complete! Ta-daaa! Clap clap clap!
We only had about eight minutes left until the plane went down, though.
Even after we hacked into the captain's BMI, the quest wouldn't be over. The landing would take time, so the whole thing was still touch-and-go.
When you fire it, start by setting up the launch pad and—
You do that. We're firing it from the roof here!
We don't have any other options.
No! Nobody's getting past the cops.
Shit...! Guess we'll have to figure something out.
I went on 4chan to check 302's current location. It was flying south from the Shinjuku area and passing through Meguro.

scenes.label: *BMI_OFF
texts: It was getting further and further away from Nakano.
We set up the drone controls while Nonno was finishing her work.
Once Nonno had moved away from the launch pad, I entered the firing command.
The next moment, I was seeing the drone's camera feed.
It soared to an immense height immediately, and began flying towards Meguro at an extreme speed.
I couldn't really tell how fast it was going though, since all I could see was clouds.
The drone was tough to control. I could only shift it up, down, left, or right.
Using the barely-visible surface landmarks as a guide, I directed it toward 302's airspace.
Damn it! It's too far away!
I entered a command to accelerate the drone.
But it quickly started losing altitude.
The drone slowed down and fell out of the sky somewhere around Shimokitazawa.

scenes.label: *mission_failed
texts: Tears welled up in Momo's eyes, and she looked down to hide them.
Like Nonno said, I should've secured the flight path, then fired it from somewhere other than Nakano.
Damn... I hate to say this, but the situation on my side isn't good, either.
Apparently, some hacker got to Lime Nukui before the Dolls did. They found his room empty.
That's all I could find out.
We couldn't do much in the previous quests, so I didn't really think we were gonna complete this one on our first try.
Still...this failure made me feel like shit.
It wasn't like it was over yet, though. As long as we didn't give up, we still had a shot.

scenes.label: *load
texts: I guess we should meet up with Lime Nukui first.
Yeah. I'm gonna start over and take care of this whole thing.
I can't let all those innocent people die.
And to save them, we had to start by getting the flight path.

scenes.label: *select1
texts: Yeah, we gotta do it before 302 goes down.

scenes.label: *notload_M1
texts: The quest's not over yet, though.
Maybe it's a good idea to keep trying until there's nothing else we can do.
I guess I shouldn't give up until it's over.
